title: Filesystem Layout
content:
Root and common directories

UNIX filesystems are arranged as a tree starting at / (root).

  • /: root
  • /etc: system configuration
  • /usr: userland programs and libraries
  • /var: variable data (logs, caches)
  • /tmp: temporary files
  • /home (Linux) or /Users (macOS): user home directories

Explore safely

ls /
ls /etc | head
ls /usr/bin | head

Paths

Absolute paths start with /. Relative paths are resolved from the current directory.

pwd
ls /etc
ls ./
